title: Pairing Together Terms
text: We can pair together the first and second terms and the third and fourth terms as shown: $$f(x)=2x^3-x^2+\left(-8x+4\right)$$
speech: We can pair together the first and second terms and the third and fourth terms as shown:  f of x is equal to 2 x cubed, minus x squared plus, parentheses, negative 8 x, plus 4,
pacedSpeech: We can pair together the first and second terms and the third and fourth terms as shown:   f of x is equal to 2 x cubed, minus x squared plus, , negative 8 x, plus 4,

title: Taking Out the Common Term
text: We can now take out a common term from each of the groupings as shown. $$f(x)=x^{2\left(2x-1\right)}-4\left(2x-1\right)$$
speech: We can now take out a common term from each of the groupings as shown.  f of x is equal to x raised to the 2 times, parentheses, 2 x minus 1,  power minus 4 times, parentheses, 2 x minus 1,
pacedSpeech: We can now take out a common term from each of the groupings as shown.   f of x is equal to x raised to the 2 times, , 2 x minus 1,  power minus 4 times, , 2 x minus 1,

title: Joining Together Both Terms
text: Now, we must merge both terms into a single expression. $$f(x)=\left(x^2-4\right) \left(2x-1\right)$$
speech: Now, we must merge both terms into a single expression.  f of x is equal to parentheses, x squared minus 4,  times, parentheses, 2 x minus 1,
pacedSpeech: Now, we must merge both terms into a single expression.   f of x is equal to , x squared minus 4,  times, , 2 x minus 1,

title: Factoring the Quadratic
text: We can actually factor $$x^2-4$$ into $$\left(x+2\right) \left(x-2\right)$$. Now, $$f(x)=\left(x+2\right) \left(x-2\right) \left(2x-1\right)$$.
speech: We can actually factor  x squared minus 4  into  parentheses x plus 2,  times, parentheses x minus 2,  . Now,  f of x is equal to parentheses x plus 2,  times, parentheses x minus 2,  times, parentheses, 2 x minus 1,  .
pacedSpeech: We can actually factor   x squared minus 4
into    x plus 2,  times,  x minus 2,
. Now,   f of x is equal to  x plus 2,  times,  x minus 2,  times, , 2 x minus 1,

title: Solving for the Intercepts
text: We can set the equation equal to $$0$$. $$0=\left(x+2\right) \left(x-2\right) \left(2x-1\right)$$. This means that $$x=-2$$, $$2$$, and $$\frac{1}{2}$$. So, our x-intercepts are (-2,0),(2,0),(1/2,0)
